185970.手のひらサイズで なんでも入る かばんが\nほしい理由を パックに 聞きますか？:
Would you ask the Pack why they want a bag
that fits everything in the palm of their
hand?<yesno><close>

185971.「ん？ パックってのは\n たしかに オレのことだけど\n オレに 何か用か？:
Hmm? Pack is my name, yes, but do you want
something from me?

185972.「ふん……ひやかしなら 帰れよ。:
If you're just going to sit here and watch, go
home.

185973.「えっ？\n 手のひらサイズで なんでも入る かばんが\n なんで ほしいのかっ:
What? Why do you want a bag that is the size of your palm and can hold everything? Ha-ha- ha.You were asked by someone like Tote to meet
with me, right? The reason I want a bag that can hold everything in the palm of my hand is because it's convenient, of course! It looks
like you're having a hard time making the bag I ordered. All right, I'll give you a special hint. If you can find Spring Leather that
<%sEV_QUE_NAME0> drops in Glen East or something, you should be able to make a bag that fits everything in the palm of your hand.
Why don't you get it and bring it to Tote? But even if you have Spring Leather, you won't be able to make it anyway.

185974.「手のひらサイズで なんでも入る かばんは\n グレン領東とかにいる <%sEV:
If there is a Spring Leather that <%sEV_QUE_NAME0> drops in Glen East or something, he should be able to make a bag
that is palm-sized and can hold everything. Why don't you get it and bring it to Tote? But even if you have Spring Leather, you won't be
able to make it anyway.

185975.「ん？ 手のひらサイズで なんでも入る\n かばん作りに必要な スプリングレザー:
Hmm? You received Spring Leather, which is needed to make a bag that fits everything in the palm of your hand? Why don't you take it
to Tote? Well, even if we had Spring Leather, we wouldn't be able to make it anyway.

185976.ストレッチかばんを 渡しますか？<yesno><case 1><break><c: Would you like me to give you a Stretchy Bag?<yesno><case 1><break><case2><close><case_cancel><close>

185978.パックは ストレッチかばんに\nありとあらゆる物を 手当たり次第に\n詰め込んで:
Packed all kinds of stuff into the Stretchy
Bag. And to his surprise, everything fit into
the bag compactly!

185979.パックは <pc>のかばんを\n強引に 奪いとった！\n<br>\nそして かば:
Pack snatched <pc>'s bag by force!
Then, he cut the bag into small pieces and re-
stitched it!

185980.「ん？ まだ何か用か？\n ……まさか 手のひらサイズで なんでも入る\n かば:
Hmm? Still need something? Don't tell me you
haven't made a bag that fits everything in the
palm of your hand?

185981.「……だよな。まあ 当然さ。\n そうそう簡単に できるわけないんだよ。:
I know, right? Well, of course. It's not that
easy to do.

185982.「え？ これが注文した かばんだって？\n フン……。こんな 小さなかばんに\n:
What? This is the bag you ordered? Hmph. There's no way I can fit everything in such a small bag. Well, never mind. If it will fit,
let's actually try it out!

185983.「なっ……！ 全部 入っただと……？\n このかばん どうなってるんだよ！？\n:
What? You got everything in here? What's going on with this bag? I intentionally gave him Difficult Orders, but he really made something
like this. Tote seems to be a pretty good bag maker, just like the rumors say. But I'm no slouch either!Listen and be amazed! I'm an up-
and-coming bag maker myself! I'm sure you're right. I'll make that bag of yours even easier to use. Give it to me!

185984.「ふふ……我ながら うまくいったぜ。\n そのかばんを トートに見せてみなよ。\:
Well, it worked out well for me. Show that bag
to Tote. You'll be amazed at my technical
prowess!

185985.「ふふ……我ながら うまくいったぜ。\n そのかばんを トートに見せてみなよ。\:
Well, it worked out well for me. Show that bag
to Tote. You'll be amazed at my technical
prowess!

185986.「オレが直してやった かばん\n 使い心地 バツグンだろ。\n<br>\n「トー:
I fixed the bag for you. It's very comfortable
to use, isn't it? Tote seems to be pretty good
at it, but I'm not losing to him either!
